A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: After a second viewing\, I can confirm I do enjoy this movie a lot. I can see why people don't like it. There are a lot of pacing problems\, moments of cheesy and bad writing\, and unnecessary subplots\, but imo those don't overshadow the film's many great elements. I've seen a lot of people give this movie terrible reviews because of pathetic nitpicking as well as claiming that it murdered their childhood. It's fine to think that\, but I just wish they would leave themselves out of it for a second and try to judge this movie as a movie\, not by how much Rian Johnson strokes their egos by pandering to their ridiculous fan theories and preconceived notions about what the star wars movies should be. And I can say\, as a movie\, it definitely has it's flaws\, but there are many moments of genuine greatness that overshadow the problems. It kept me guessing\, and the payoffs weren't anything like what I was anticipating\, but I found this to be a positive. Some will say this movie cucked them\, but if you have an open mind and haven't obsessed over elaborate theories in your head\, I think you will be entertained by this movie
